alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Allegany; Extreme Western Allegany; Garrett (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued October 18 at 4:02AM EDT until October 18 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures around 26 to 32 degrees, mainly for elevations above 1500 feet. * WHERE...In Maryland, Garrett and Allegany Counties. In West Virginia, Hampshire, Hardy and Eastern Mineral Counties. * WHEN...Until 10 AM EDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Central and Eastern Allegany; Extreme Western Allegany; Garrett
